raw_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) extended the one sense per discourse idea (Yarowsky, 1995) to multiple topically related documents and propagate consistent event arguments across sentences and documents
clean_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) extended the one sense per discourse idea (Yarowsky, 1995) to multiple topically related documents and propagate consistent event arguments across sentences and documents.

raw_text: We then apply the cross-document inference techniques as described in (Ji and Grishman, 2008) to improve trigger and argument labeling performance by favoring interpretation consistency across the test events and background events
clean_text: We then apply the cross-document inference techniques as described in (Ji and Grishman, 2008) to improve trigger and argument labeling performance by favoring interpretation consistency across the test events and background events.

raw_text: Later, Ji and Grishman (2008) employed a rule-based approach to propagate consistent triggers and arguments across topic-related documents
clean_text: Later, Ji and Grishman (2008) employed a rule-based approach to propagate consistent triggers and arguments across topic-related documents.

raw_text: (Ji and Grishman 2008) have observed that the events in a cluster of documents on the same topics as documents in the training corpus can be tagged more confidently
clean_text: (Ji and Grishman 2008) have observed that the events in a cluster of documents on the same topics as documents in the training corpus can be tagged more confidently.

raw_text: We followed Ji and Grishman (2008)? s approach and used the INDRI retrieval system4 (Strohman et al, 2005) to obtain the top N 4http: //www.lemurproject.org/indri/ related documents for each annotated document in the training corpus
clean_text: We followed Ji and Grishman (2008)'s approach and used the INDRI retrieval system (Strohman et al, 2005) to obtain the top N related documents for each annotated document in the training corpus.

raw_text: Previous studies pointed out that information from wider scope, at the document or cross-document level, could provide non-local information to aid event extraction (Ji and Grishman 2008, Liao and Grishman 2010a)

There are two common assumptions within a cluster of related documents (Ji and Grishman 2008):? Trigger Consistency Per Cluster: if one instance of a word triggers an event, other instances of the same word will trigger events of the same type
clean_text: There are two common assumptions within a cluster of related documents (Ji and Grishman 2008): Trigger Consistency Per Cluster: if one instance of a word triggers an event, other instances of the same word will trigger events of the same type.

raw_text: For ST_IR and ST_GI, we retrieved the best N (using N= 25, which (Ji and Grishman 2008) found to work best) related texts for each training document from the English TDT5 corpus consisting of 278,108 news texts (from April to September of 2003)
clean_text: For ST_IR and ST_GI, we retrieved the best N (using N=25, which (Ji and Grishman 2008) found to work best) related texts for each training document from the English TDT5 corpus consisting of 278,108 news texts (from April to September of 2003).

raw_text: The most salient work for event extraction is Grishman et al (2005) and JiandGrishman (2008)
clean_text: The most salient work for event extraction is Grishman et al (2005) and Jiand and Grishman (2008).

raw_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) further exploit a correlation between senses of verbs (that are triggers for events) and topics of documents. Our work shares some similarities
clean_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) further exploit a correlation between senses of verbs (that are triggers for events) and topics of documents. Our work shares some similarities.

raw_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) enforce event role consistency across different documents
clean_text: Ji and Grishman (2008) enforce event role consistency across different documents.

raw_text: Finkel et al (2005) and Ji and Grishman (2008) incorporate global information by enforcing event role or label consistency over a document or across related documents

raw_text: A typical event extraction/discovery system (Ji and Grishman, 2008) fails to discover the war event due to the lack of context information (Ben son et al, 2011), and thus fails to shed light on the users focus/interests
clean_text: A typical event extraction/discovery system (Ji and Grishman, 2008) fails to discover the war event due to the lack of context information (Benson et al, 2011), and thus fails to shed light on the users focus/interests.
